---
title: "Housing Policies"
---

## Overview

This lecture examines various housing policies and their economic effects, including rent control, housing subsidies, zoning regulations, and affordable housing programs.

## Key Topics

- Rent control
  - Short-run vs. long-run effects
  - Quality deterioration
  - Misallocation
  - Black markets
  - Evidence from different cities

- Housing subsidies
  - Public housing
  - Housing vouchers (Section 8)
  - Low-Income Housing Tax Credit
  - Efficiency and equity trade-offs

- Land-use regulation
  - Zoning and density restrictions
  - The housing supply elasticity
  - NIMBYism and local opposition
  - Effects on affordability and segregation

- Homelessness
  - Causes: housing costs, mental health, substance abuse
  - Policy responses
  - Housing First approach

## Policy Debates

- How can cities increase housing affordability?
- What are the trade-offs between different housing policies?
- The role of supply-side vs. demand-side interventions
